stories.text:
I ask this generally, it's not aimed at a specific subject or niche. I'm also not hoping for "split the room" style answers (e.g. jam-then-cream is better than cream-then-jam, or cats > dogs, etc.).

Examples of beliefs (not my beliefs I should note) that run against the grain might include things like:

* Facebook is not an evil company and the world really is better off with Zuckerberg's incessant pursuit of "connecting everyone".

* On average, the net effect of Climate change is will be good for humanity.

* Avatar is the greatest film ever made.

A good answer should include some degree of reasoning about the statement: <statement> is true because <reasons>. Also, ideally avoiding truly controversial and sensitive topics that could start flame wars.
stories.title: Ask HN: What convictions do you hold that are antithetical to popular belief?

stories.text:
In short: I'm from Ukraine. For many years i hear how google and other company implement different tracking devices to help in sitaution X that the option will be useful to protect / find / save someones life.

Right now as you know in Ukraine - war with russian occupants. And do you know what?)

Z E R O - emergency services that must protect people working from google or other companies.

I have one question: if they does not work in the worst thing ever - war. Why do the things must be included in devices? Remove these services, and stop lying about such services which is included (prooven by war) just for ads only. And does not offer any real help.
stories.title: All rescue functions in modern devices do not work in cases of real danger
